name: Colicodendron martianum
remarks: Eponymy: the epithet honors Carl Friedrich Philipp von Martius (1794–1868), author of the genus Colicodendron, and one of the editors of Flora Brasiliensis.

name: Cynophalla amazonica
distribution: Acre (Brazil North, Brazil, Southern America);Amapá (Brazil North, Brazil, Southern America);Maranhão (Brazil Northeast, Brazil, Southern America);Mato Grosso (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America);Pará (Brazil North, Brazil, Southern America);Rondônia (Brazil North, Brazil, Southern America);Bolivia (Western South America, Southern America);
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.461.3.7 The epithet refers to the distinctive mostly Amazonian distribution of this novelty.

name: Dactylaena zmarztyae
distribution: Bahia (Brazil Northeast, Brazil, Southern America);Espírito Santo (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America);Rio de Janeiro (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America);
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364420X15935294613563 The epithet is an honour to Sue Zmarzty (Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew), who annotated a number of specimens of this species as possibly new to science but did not publish it.

name: Tarenaya bernadeteana
distribution: Espírito Santo (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: doi:10.3417/2022705 Etymology: 'The specific epithet is in honor of Maria Bernadete Costa-e-Silva, who dedicated her research to the study of the Brazilian species of Cleome'.

name: Tarenaya curvispina
